availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Vincent Braswell (Hopkins Co. coal digger and soldier in the 17th + 25th Ky Inf.)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, coal digger and soldier. Tennessee native. Married to Lucinda A. Sisk Braswell in Robertson County, Tennessee, on August 5, 1853. Father of Mary E. Braswell, Samuel H. Braswell, and Martha Braswell. Laborer in Robertson County in 1850. Coal digger in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a sergeant from January 1, 1862 to April 13, 1862. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from April 13, 1862 to June 22, 1862. Died while in military service at Henderson, Kentucky, on June 22, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Robertson County, District 5, p. 37B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 639.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Robertson County Marriages, 1878-1886.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Rolls 0299, 0373.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 960-1.
